enum-member.comment: Allocate a new permanent ueIndex for a new UE
enum-member.name: EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_Allocate

enum-member.comment: Reassign an ueIndex for an UE already having a temporary ueIndex
enum-member.name: EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_Reassign

enum-member.comment: Free all ueIndexs assigned to a cell
enum-member.name: EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_FreeAll

enum-member.comment: Pre-reserve one ueIndex from a selected UE Group. FSMr3 only
enum-member.name: EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_GroupReserve

enum-member.comment: Free one pre-reserved ueIndex in the given UE Group. FSMr3 only
enum-member.name: EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_GroupFree

enum-member.comment: Free one pre-reserved ueIndex in the given UE Group. FSMr3 only MAC PS should handle it just like EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_GroupFree and return type in Resp.
enum-member.name: EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_GroupFreeInternal

enum-member.comment: DCM HDBDE only: Allocate a new permanent ueIndex for SCell UE added without HO
enum-member.name: EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_AllocateSCellAdd

enum-member.comment: DCM HDBDE only: Allocate a new permanent ueIndex for SCell UE added with HO
enum-member.name: EUeIndexMgmtOperationType_AllocateSCellAddByHo

dimension.variableSizeFieldComment: Value is 0 in FSMr2, and in FSMr3 for uREC (before LBT1886). Value 1 indicates a non Super Pool configuration, where only one local own pool. Any higher value indicates a Super Pool configuration with multiple pools.

member.comment: The message result information is split into the following parts: status, cause and specificCause

member.comment: Number of UE Groups. The value is copied from the related request. In FSMr2 always 1. If UE Group specific addressing is not needed by LTE MAC PS, it provides same address for all UE Groups.
member.name: numOfUeGroups

member.comment: UE Group specific addresses to PsUser_UL service. FSMr3 onwards, in FSMr2 can be set to zeroes. numOfUeGroups defines number of valid addresses in the array.

member.comment: Addresses of testability services in LTE L2 and MAC PS. Addresses are only for test tool usage and not to be used for eNB internal communication. WMP only. FSMr3 onwards.

The field specifies whether to stop all cell related scheduling (including system information) or only UE related scheduling.
0 = shutDownUE 1 = shutDownCell
For WMP shutDownCell is always used.

message.comment: Manage UE Indexes (FSMr2 and FSMr3) and UE Group allocations (only FSMr3)
message.name: PS_UeIndexMgmtReq

member.comment: cell Id
member.name: cellId

member.comment: In case typeOfOperation == ueIndexFreeAll and relatedPcell (new IE) is not equal to cellId, intention is to release all Scell UE indices which are related to the given Pcell id. Before LN6.0/LNT4.0 (LTE1558): In case typeOfOperation == ueIndexFree and relatedPcell is not equal to cellId, intention is to release Scell UE index which is related to the given Pcell id. LN6.0/LNT4.0 (LTE1558) onwards: If typeOfOperation == ueIndexFree, the ueIndex to be released is provided.
member.name: relatedPCell

member.comment: Ue Id.
member.name: ueId

member.comment: Type of the request
member.name: operationType

member.comment: Identifies the UE in DSP Pool. Valid if typeOfOperation is ueIndexAllocate or ueIndexReassign, otherwise INVALID_UEINDEX.
member.name: ueIndex

member.comment: In WMP (before LBT2087): UE Group of the UE. Valid if typeOfOperation is ueIndexAllocate, ueIndexReassign or ueGroupFree, otherwise set to INVALID_UEGROUP. In DCM: Co-located UE Group (at intra-Pool HO/Reest) or INVALID_UEGROUP. Valid if typeOfOperation is ueIndexAllocate or ueIndexReassign, otherwise INVALID_UEGROUP. In Macro and uREC always INVALID_UEGROUP.
member.name: ueGroup
